snippet: If you’re looking for social running experiences, the city has plenty, with the New York Road Runners, Jeff Galloway teams, Front Runners, JackRabbit and others.
abstract: Urban Athlete column lists running groups that offer a social running experience in New York City. Photo (M)9
lead_paragraph: IT'S only May, but I've already begun thinking about Nov. 4, when I'm scheduled to run the New York City Marathon. I ran it successfully -- if less than spectacularly -- in 2007, but I went over my five-hour goal by 15 minutes. I knew I would try again, and I know I'll need help staying motivated. Thankfully, for those seeking the support of a more social running experience, New York has many options. NEW YORK ROAD RUNNERSMore than 30 races are scheduled each year by the New York Road Runners. Most are in Central Park, but a few will have you in other parts of the city. The Wall Street Run (on May 31), which weaves through the financial district, and the borough half-marathons are favorites. The Brooklyn half, my first long run of the year, on May 19, is sold out, but races in Queens, the Bronx and Staten Island are still ahead. The Road Runners also have classes, from beginner to competitive, and the next wave of 10-week sessions begins on May 22. The $40 annual membership grants discounted fees for races and classes.
